Tasks.Name: AWS Concepts and Services
Tasks.Description: Gain a foundational understanding of AWS core concepts, key services, and the AWS cloud architecture.

Subtasks.Name: Introduction to AWS
Subtasks.Description: Learn about the history, benefits, and use cases of AWS.

Subtasks.Name: AWS Global Infrastructure
Subtasks.Description: Explore the AWS global infrastructure, regions, and availability zones.

Subtasks.Name: Compute Services (EC2, Lambda)
Subtasks.Description: Understand the different types of compute services available on AWS, including EC2 and Lambda.

Subtasks.Name: Storage Services (S3, EBS)
Subtasks.Description: Learn about AWS storage options, including S3 for object storage and EBS for block storage.

Subtasks.Name: Networking Services (VPC, Route 53)
Subtasks.Description: Explore the AWS networking model, including VPCs, subnets, and Route 53 for DNS.

Tasks.Name: Hands-on Practice with AWS
Tasks.Description: Apply your knowledge by working through practical exercises and building simple AWS projects.

Subtasks.Name: Create an AWS Account
Subtasks.Description: Sign up for a free AWS account and familiarize yourself with the AWS Management Console.

Subtasks.Name: Launch an EC2 Instance
Subtasks.Description: Learn how to launch and configure a virtual machine (EC2 instance) on AWS.

Subtasks.Name: Deploy a Simple Web Application
Subtasks.Description: Build a basic web application using AWS services and deploy it to AWS.

Subtasks.Name: Explore AWS Console and CLI
Subtasks.Description: Gain proficiency in using the AWS Management Console and the AWS Command Line Interface (CLI).

Tasks.Name: Infrastructure as Code (IaC)
Tasks.Description: Learn about Infrastructure as Code (IaC) and its benefits. Master tools like CloudFormation and Terraform for automated infrastructure provisioning.

Subtasks.Name: Introduction to IaC
Subtasks.Description: Understand the principles of Infrastructure as Code (IaC) and its advantages.

Subtasks.Name: AWS CloudFormation
Subtasks.Description: Learn how to use AWS CloudFormation to define and manage your AWS resources using templates.

Subtasks.Name: Terraform for AWS
Subtasks.Description: Explore Terraform, an open-source tool, to manage AWS infrastructure using declarative configuration.

Subtasks.Name: Practical IaC Projects
Subtasks.Description: Build real-world IaC projects using either CloudFormation or Terraform.

Tasks.Name: CI/CD Pipelines with AWS
Tasks.Description: Learn to create Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) pipelines using AWS services like CodePipeline and CodeBuild.

Subtasks.Name: AWS CodePipeline
Subtasks.Description: Learn about AWS CodePipeline and its role in automating the release process.

Subtasks.Name: AWS CodeBuild
Subtasks.Description: Understand how AWS CodeBuild works to build, test, and package your applications.

Subtasks.Name: Building CI/CD Pipelines
Subtasks.Description: Practice creating CI/CD pipelines using AWS CodePipeline and CodeBuild.

Subtasks.Name: Implementing CI/CD best practices
Subtasks.Description: Learn about best practices for designing and implementing efficient and secure CI/CD pipelines.

Tasks.Name: Monitoring and Logging
Tasks.Description: Learn how to monitor and log your AWS applications and infrastructure using services like CloudWatch and CloudTrail.

Subtasks.Name: AWS CloudWatch
Subtasks.Description: Explore AWS CloudWatch for monitoring your applications and infrastructure.

Subtasks.Name: AWS CloudTrail
Subtasks.Description: Understand how to use CloudTrail to audit and track activity in your AWS environment.

Subtasks.Name: Setting up Monitoring and Logging
Subtasks.Description: Configure CloudWatch and CloudTrail to monitor and log your AWS resources.
